p: In China, a fast-spreading HIV epidemic among MSM constitutes a challenge to efforts to control the HIV pandemic. The annual rate of newly reported HIV cases attributed to MSM in China has increased from 2.5% in 2006 to 28.3% in 2015 [ 3, 4]. According to national sentinel surveillance data, the prevalence of HIV infection among MSM has increased from 0.9% in 2003 to 8.0% in 2015 [ 3, 5]. A meta-analysis found that the national HIV incidence among Chinese MSM was 5.0 per 100 person-years (95% CI: 4.1%-5.8%) [ 6], which was much higher than that of any other population in China.
